(Yeah, I did ask for it)

Shadow Wing::

She listened to the story with great interest. She couldn't believe 
that a bot could live that long.  She couldn't help but feel a little 
respect for a bot that had survived all odds and made it. She would 
have smiled if she could. She knew that this bot could teach her a 
lot and she was willing to learn.  Then she heard him say he was 
going to leave. "Oh no please, don't leave."  She had just found 
contact with another and didn't want to be left alone again. Not in 
her state, not without control of her own form. She hated this 
feeling of complete helplessness.  "Please stay.  I have many 
questions for you. Please?" She did have questions, but was more 
worried about being alone right now.



--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> Veratis listened to Shadow Wing carefully trying to hear if she 
> understood. he tried not to laugh. Shadow Wing was like a new 
child., 
> filled with wonder and curiosity.Everything was "Why".
> 
> "I began hundreds of years ago, back before the Maximals and 
> Predacons began being so stubborn about thier titles and functions. 
I 
> was a scientist trying to figure out the advantages of 
colinization. 
> I was at a potential settlement when we experienced a cave in. My 
> scanners took over and located a bloodthirst nocturnal creature 
> called a Veratis hence the name. My settlement continued in that 
> cavefor over 100 years. When we were finally rescued I was sent 
> elsewhere. I found a planet called Avaria. It was remarkable, plant 
> and Animal life spread through the entire system. There were 
already 
> Translife forms present, it was our job to help them adapt. 
> Unfortunately a plague of insecticons plundered through the system 
> destroying all life they encountered. We had to do something to 
> prevent Avaria from becoming a dead planet. We scanned the worlds 
> that were destroyed and the planets they avoided. The biggest 
> difference was a dominance of avian creatures. It turned out that 
> these creatures thrived on insect life. The insecticons natural 
> instinct to survive did the rest. I integrated the qualities of the 
> avian creatures into the settlers DNA and they wiped the planet 
clean 
> of insecticons. As a reward for my contributions ?I was given a 
> member of the highest function to care for as an apprentice, a 
> student. I learned to care for her as a daughter. (Lady Hawk)
> 
> I guided her in the study of courtesy, Status, and the words of the 
> great leaders. I've been studying the Destiny of Prime. The Great 
> Autobot leader stated he would "Leave us till the day when all are 
> one." I believe that it's the day when cybertron and all the 
colonies 
> realize that Maximal and Predacon, Autobot and Decepticon, Aviabot 
> and Insecticon, the titles don't matter, only the robot seperates 
us 
> from the beasts. I help because I believe in the day Prime 
predicted 
> and I believe I have the capability to help it along." He paused to 
> let his tale sink in.
> 
> "One night I was relaxing in a district station waiting for my 
cargo 
> to be aproved when a young Maximal(Foxfingers) bumped into me at 
full 
> sprint. He'd been hurt pretty badly by a Predacon named Termitron. 
> The station as it turned out was under Pred law. I didn't want to 
be 
> involved in a legal squabble but unfortunately the Predacons didn't 
> care.Myself and the young Maximal took care of business and he was 
> placed in my custody to be returned at my convenience. We've been 
> traveling the universe together since doing good on every planet we 
> choose. 
> 
> "I detected a large amount of Translife forms on this planet and 
> decided to investigate. Lunarpine found me and I agreed to help."
> Veratis relaxed, the story and the stress causing problems to his 
> system. "If you'll excuse me I must rest."
>  --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> > ::Shadow Wing::
> > 
> > She was relieved to hear that Luanrpine was alright. She still 
felt 
> > cold and wasn't sure why.  She felt drained and almost exhausted 
> > though she didn't know why. She could only truely 'feel'(close to 
> the 
> > sence of touch) the connection she had with Veratis.  But the 
fear 
> of 
> > the unknown and not having any sence of control scared her beyond 
> any 
> > measure of fear she had ever had before. "Please tell me 
> Veratis,,why 
> > are you helping us? Please tell me who you are? Where did you 
come 
> > from?" She was hoping that she might either make friends with 
this 
> > Veratis or gain some sort of advantage.  She was to scared not to 
> try 
> > to do something. Even if it was only talking. 
> > 
> > 
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, cyberwolf4@p... wrote:
> > > "I communicated with him not to long ago, he has what we need, 
he 
> > > just said he wanted to check something out at the base. The Ark 
I 
> > > believe he called it." Veratis was throwing in words and facts 
he 
> > was 
> > > sure she knew. Outside the link he monitored the different 
> > reactions 
> > > his words received.
> > >
